<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.2 is: Functions shall not call themselves, either directly or indirectly.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of metal_linux_irq_set_enable:
```c
static void metal_linux_irq_set_enable(struct metal_irq_controller *irq_cntr,
				       int irq, unsigned int state)
{
	int offset, ret;

	if (irq < irq_cntr->irq_base ||
	    irq >= irq_cntr->irq_base + irq_cntr->irq_num) {
		metal_log(METAL_LOG_ERROR, "%s: invalid irq %d\n",
			  __func__, irq);
		return;
	}
	offset = irq - linux_irq_cntr.irq_base;
	metal_mutex_acquire(&irq_lock);
	if (state == METAL_IRQ_ENABLE)
		metal_bitmap_set_bit(irqs_enabled, offset);
	else
		metal_bitmap_clear_bit(irqs_enabled, offset);
	metal_mutex_release(&irq_lock);
	/* Notify IRQ thread that IRQ state has changed */
	ret = metal_linux_irq_notify();
	if (ret < 0) {
		metal_log(METAL_LOG_ERROR,
			  "%s: failed to notify set %d enable\n",
			  __func__, irq);
	}
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are close to the target function metal_linux_irq_set_enable:
static int metal_linux_irq_notify(void)
{
	uint64_t val = 1;
	int ret;

	ret = write(irq_notify_fd, &val, sizeof(val));
	if (ret < 0) {
		metal_log(METAL_LOG_ERROR, "%s failed\n", __func__);
	}
	return ret;
}
</additional code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
metal_mutex_acquire(&irq_lock);
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 17.2 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation in the provided code. The call metal_mutex_acquire(&irq_lock) inside metal_linux_irq_set_enable does not, from the given code, call metal_linux_irq_set_enable again directly or indirectly. A violation would occur only if the mutex acquire implementation (or functions it calls, e.g. debugging callbacks, hooks, or logging callbacks invoked during acquire) invoked metal_linux_irq_set_enable (for example: metal_linux_irq_set_enable -> metal_mutex_acquire -> mutex_debug_callback -> metal_linux_irq_set_enable), creating an indirect recursive cycle. There is no evidence of such a call chain in the supplied code.
